text:
Hi, I am the host of this show,
"Cooking With Dog."

Okay, let's have her prepare the toppings
for Udon Noodles.
Chop the long green onion into fine pieces.
Chop up the stem of the Shiso leaves.
Grate the Daikon radish.
Grate the ginger.
Let's make a soft boiled egg in a microwave.

To prevent the egg from exploding,
make small holes on the yolk.

Cover the bowl with the plastic wrap and then,
microwave about 30 to 40 seconds.

Adjust the cooking time,
based on the wattage of your microwave.
Okay, let's make tempura batter.
Add cold water in a bowl.
Sift tempura flour into the bowl and add 'Aonori.'
Lightly mix the batter.
Be careful not to over mix.
Let's Make 'Bukkake Dashi' sauce.
Add water, Mirin and sugar.
Now, turn on the stove.

When it start simmering,
add the soy sauce and granulated Dashi.
Stir for a moment and turn off the stove.
Let's make 'Chikuwa Isobe-Age.'
Check if the oil is hot enough.

Dip the Chikuwa (Tube-shaped fish cake)
into the batter.

Deep-fry the Chikuwa in hot oil,
that is about 340 degrees Fahrenheit (170C).

When it is cooked, place the Chikuwa 
on kitchen paper to soak up excess tempura oil.
Okay, let's cook Udon Noodles.

Drop the frozen Udon,
into a large pot of boiling water.

Heat the Udon noodles for about
one (1) minute and lightly untangle them.
Drain and rinse the noodles with running water.

Soak the noodles in icy water,
and let them cool completely.
Drain water, from the noodle well.
That is it for cooking.
Let's serve the Udon with the toppings.
Fold the noodles in a Bowl.
Add a Shiso leaf...
Chikuwa isobe-age...
Soft boiled egg...
Grated Daikon...
Ginger...

Chopped long green onion and
toasted white sesame seeds.
Finally, add the cold Bukkake Dashi sauce.
Udon Noodles and many delicious toppings.
This is a great recipe in hot summer.
It might be difficult to find some of the ingredients.

But, I hope you try it yourself.
Good luck in the kitchen!
